p: Except for the above-mentioned hemolytic activity by H 2O 2, a few mycoplasmas can also secrete hemolysin, which is thought to lyse erythrocytes by forming pores on the cell membrane to obtain membrane precursors [ 103]. In this way, mycoplasmas can efficiently acquire macromolecular precursors from host and simultaneously exert an important pathogenic role which contributes to the survival of mycoplasmas.
